data.title: Tina Turner, Ike Turner’s son Ronnie passed away at age of 62
data.meta_description: Ronnie Turner, Tina Turner's son, was recently found dead at his Los Angeles home, resulting in a devastating loss for Tina Turner and her family.
data.text:
Synopsis

Ronnie Turner, Tina Turner's son, was recently found dead at his Los Angeles home, resulting in a devastating loss for Tina Turner and her family.

Tina Turner and her family just suffered a tragic loss as her son Ronnie Turner was recently found dead at his LA residence. Emergency services received a 911 call, possibly from Ronnie’s wife, Feda, Thursday morning, who reported that Ronnie was having difficulty breathing just outside their home and asked them to rush there. As the paramedics reached the San Fernando Valley address, they saw his neighbour’s performing CPR, but their efforts were in vain, and Ronnie was declared dead.

The reason behind Ronnie’s medical complications and death is still unclear, but he’s known to be having health issues and was also battling cancer. His mother hasn’t given any response to his passing yet. Ronnie had put his name in Hollywood acting in the 1993 movie ‘What’s Love Got to Do With It’ in which he co-starred with his mother. Ronnie was born to Tina and Ike in 1960. Tina’s eldest son Craig with musician Raymond Hill was a realtor and committed suicide in 2018 by shooting himself in his Studio City home.

Tina had two more children with Ike, Ike Jr and Mike. The couple separated in 1976 after Tina accused Ike of hitting her. Ike later died from a heroin overdose in 2007. Tina had given birth to Craig before meeting Ike but later adopted him when she married. Her first son with Ike was Ronnie. Ronnie lived in his Los Angeles home with his wife, Feda and had battled with cancer for a long time.

FAQs:

Who is Ronnie Turner?

Ronnie Turner was the son of popular actress-singer Tina Turner and her husband, Ike Turner.

How did Tina Turner’s eldest son die?

Craig, Tina’s eldest son, committed suicide in 2018 by shooting himself.
